import re
from collections import Counter

def word_frequency(text):
    """"""
    text = re.sub('[^\\w\\s]', '', text.upper())
    word_count = Counter(text.split())
    sorted_words = sorted(word_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    return sorted_words

import re
from collections import Counter

def word_frequency(text):
    """
    This function takes a string as input, converts it to all uppercase, 
    removes any punctuation marks, counts the frequency of each word, 
    and returns the words in descending order of their frequency.

    Args:
        text (str): The input string.

    Returns:
        list: A list of tuples containing the words and their frequencies.
    """
    text = re.sub('', '', text.upper())
    word_count = Counter(text.split())
    sorted_words = sorted(word_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    return sorted_words

import re
from collections import Counter

def word_frequency(text):
    """
    This function takes a string as input, converts it to all uppercase, 
    removes any punctuation marks, counts the frequency of each word, 
    and returns the words in descending order of their frequency.

    Args:
        text (str): The input string.

    Returns:
        list: A list of tuples containing the words and their frequencies.
    """
    text = re.sub('[^\\w\\s]', 'MUTATED', text.upper())
    word_count = Counter(text.split())
    sorted_words = sorted(word_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    return sorted_words

mutants.mutated_line: sorted_words = sorted(word_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=False)

    """
    This function takes a string as input, converts it to all uppercase,

mutants.code:
import re
from collections import Counter

def word_frequency(text):
    """
    This function takes a string as input, converts it to all uppercase, 
    removes any punctuation marks, counts the frequency of each word, 
    and returns the words in descending order of their frequency.

    Args:
        text (str): The input string.

    Returns:
        list: A list of tuples containing the words and their frequencies.
    """
    text = re.sub('[^\\w\\s]', '', text.upper())
    word_count = Counter(text.split())
    sorted_words = sorted(word_count.items(), key=lambda x: x[-1], reverse=True)
    return sorted_words
